sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词的有"报道，叙述"之意。
means: account ：普通用词，不如report正式，侧重对亲身经历或目睹之事所作的书面或口头的报道或叙述。
report ：正式用词，多指报刊上的报道，强调对情况经过调查或审核后作出的详尽叙述，具有一定权威性。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"说明"之意。
means: explain ： 含义广，最普通用词，指把某事向原来不了解、不清楚的人解释明白、说清楚等。
interpret ： 着重以特殊的知识、经验来解释难理解的事情。
illustrate ： 多指用实例或插图、图表加以说明。
clarify ： 指把已发生的事件。情况和现状说清楚。
account ： 说明某事物如何符合自然法则或逻辑。

sentence.Network_en: You have to take capital appreciation of the property into account.
sentence.Network_cn: 你必须将该处房产的资本增值考虑在内。

sentence.Network_en: He figured up the balance in their checking account.
sentence.Network_cn: 他算出了他们活期存款账户上的余额总和。

sentence.Network_en: The direction of the prevailing winds should be taken into account.
sentence.Network_cn: 应该将盛行风的方向考虑在内。

当责（ACCOUNTABILITY）不只是负责，是要完成“自己承诺的事”，为最终成果负起完全责任，就算有不可抗力的意外，也不能摆出“ …

jx.jx_en_mean: To constitute the governing or primary factor
jx.jx_cn_mean: 导致，引起：构成决定性的或主要的因素

lj.lj_ly: Bad weather accounted for the long delay.
lj.lj_ls: 长期的延缓是因为坏天气

jx.jx_en_mean: To provide an explanation or justification

lj.lj_ly: The suspect couldn't account for his time that night.
lj.lj_ls: 嫌疑犯不能说明那天晚上他的时间安排

jx.jx_en_mean: according to what one has heard or read

lj.lj_ly: by all accounts he is a pretty nice guy.
lj.lj_ls: 据说他是个非常好的人。

jx.jx_en_mean: require someone to explain a mistake or poor performance

phrase.cizu_name: give a good (或 bad) account of oneself

jx.jx_en_mean: make a favourable (or unfavourable) impression through one's performance
fail or decline to consider a factor
denominations of money used in reckoning but not current as coins
with one's own money or assets, rather than for an employer or client

lj.lj_ly: he began trading on his own account.

phrase.cizu_name: take something into account (或 take account of)

jx.jx_en_mean: consider a specified thing along with other factors before reaching a decision or taking action
jx.jx_cn_mean: （在决定或行动之前）将…考虑进去

phrase.cizu_name: there's no accounting for tastes (或 taste)

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)it's impossible to explain why different people like different things, especially those things which the speaker considers unappealing

means.word_mean: 帐目,帐单
故事;理由;叙述
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (in the sense 'counting', 'to count'): from Old French acont (noun), aconter (verb), based on conter 'to count'

encyclopedia.content: 英语词语，n.计算， 帐目， 说明， 估计， 理由；vi.说明， 总计有， 认为， 得分；vt.认为。另有会计术语，意为计账户。

entry.def: If you have an account with a bank or a similar organization, you have an arrangement to leave your money there and take some out when you need it.

example.ex: Some banks make it difficult to open an account...
example.tran: 一些银行把开户弄得很麻烦。

example.ex: I had two accounts with Natwest, a savings account and a current account.
example.tran: 我在国民威斯敏斯特银行有两个账户，一个储蓄账户和一个活期存款账户。

entry.tran: 固定客户，老主顾（尤指公司）
entry.def: In business, a regular customer of a company can be referred to as an account, especially when the customer is another company.

example.ex: Biggart Donald, the Glasgow-based marketing agency, has won two Edinburgh accounts.
example.tran: 比加特·唐纳德，这家驻格拉斯哥的营销代理公司已赢得了两个爱丁堡的客户。

entry.def: Accounts are detailed records of all the money that a person or business receives and spends.

example.ex: He kept detailed accounts.
example.tran: 他记明细账。

example.ex: ...an account book.
example.tran: 账本

entry.tran: （书面或口头的）记述，描述，陈述，报告
entry.def: An account is a written or spoken report of something that has happened.

example.ex: He gave a detailed account of what happened on the fateful night...
example.tran: 他详细描述了那个灾难性夜晚所发生的事。

example.ex: According to police accounts, Mr and Mrs Hunt were found dead on the floor of their kitchen.
example.tran: 据警方称，亨特夫妇被发现死在家里厨房的地板上。

entry.def: An account of something is a theory which is intended to explain or describe it.

example.ex: This basic utilitarian model gives a relatively unsophisticated account of human behaviour...
example.tran: 这个实用的基础模型较为简略地解释了人类的行为。

example.ex: Science, on Weber's account, is an essentially value-free activity.
example.tran: 按照韦伯的说法，科学在本质上是一种价值无涉的活动。

entry.def: If you say that something is accounted a particular thing, you are reporting someone's judgment or opinion that it is that thing.

example.ex: The opening day of the battle was, nevertheless, accounted a success.
example.tran: 不过，开战的首日仍被认为是成功的。

example.ex: ...homosexuals, whose sexual behaviour is still accounted sinful by the church.
example.tran: 其性行为仍然被教会认为是罪孽深重的同性恋者

entry.def: If you say that something is true by all accounts or from all accounts, you believe it is true because other people say so.

example.ex: He is, by all accounts, a superb teacher.
example.tran: 他是位有口皆碑的好老师。

entry.tran: （尽管未必大获全胜但）出色地表现（自己）
entry.def: If you say that someone gave a good account of themselves in a particular situation, you mean that they performed well, although they may not have been completely successful.

example.ex: The team fought hard and gave a good account of themselves.
example.tran: 这支队伍奋力拼搏，表现出色。

entry.def: If you say that something is of no account or of little account, you mean that it is very unimportant and is not worth considering.

example.ex: These obscure groups were of little account in national politics.
example.tran: 这些名不见经传的团体在国内政界无足轻重。

entry.tran: 以赊账方式;以分期付款方式
entry.def: If you buy or pay for something on account, you pay nothing or only part of the cost at first, and pay the rest later.

example.ex: He bought two bottles of vodka on account.
example.tran: 他挂账买了两瓶伏特加酒。

entry.def: You use on account of to introduce the reason or explanation for something.

example.ex: The President declined to deliver the speech himself, on account of a sore throat...
example.tran: 总统因嗓子不适而婉拒了亲自讲话。

example.ex: A newly-married couple, he thought, on account of their walking so close together.
example.tran: 看俩人走路时挨得这么近，他觉得他们是新婚夫妇。

entry.tran: 从（某人的）角度；（尤指）设想处于（某人的）情况
entry.def: Your feelings on someone's account are the feelings you have about what they have experienced or might experience, especially when you imagine yourself to be in their situation.

example.ex: Mollie told me what she'd done and I was really scared on her account.
example.tran: 莫莉告诉我她的所作所为，我真是替她感到后怕。

entry.def: If you tell someone not to do something on your account, you mean that they should do it only if they want to, and not because they think it will please you.

example.ex: Don't leave on my account.
example.tran: 别因为我就走了。

entry.def: If you say that something should on no account be done, you are emphasizing that it should not be done under any circumstances.

example.ex: On no account should the mixture boil.
example.tran: 切勿让这种混合物沸腾。

entry.def: You can use on that account or on this account when you want to say that something happens for the reason you have just mentioned.

example.ex: Wine is radioactive but few people stop drinking it on that account.
example.tran: 酒是有放射性的，可是很少有人因此而戒酒。

entry.def: If you say that something concerning a particular person is true by his or her own account, you mean that you believe it because that person has said it is true.

example.ex: He was by his own account an ambitious workaholic.
example.tran: 据他自己所言，他是个雄心勃勃的工作狂。

entry.tran: 作为个人地；为自身利益地
entry.def: If you take part in a business activity on your own account, you do it for yourself, and not as a representative or employee of a company.

example.ex: She had plans to set up in business on her own account.
example.tran: 她计划自己创业。

entry.tran: 自主自愿地;责任自负地
entry.def: If you do something on your own account, you do it because you want to and without being asked, and you take responsibility for your own action.

example.ex: I told him if he withdrew it was on his own account.
example.tran: 我告诉他，如果他退出，责任自负。

entry.tran: （与敌人或对手）决战，算账，了结恩怨
entry.def: To settle accounts with an enemy or opponent means to bring your fight or quarrel to an end by defeating them.

example.ex: ...until the great day came when the Germans could finally settle accounts with the British...
example.tran: 直到德国人最终能和英国人清算旧账的重大日子的来临

example.ex: Their sleep is regularly disturbed by the sound of gunfire as criminal gangs settle their nightly accounts.
example.tran: 他们经常被黑帮每晚火拼的枪声所吵醒。

entry.def: If you take something into account, or take account of something, you consider it when you are thinking about a situation or deciding what to do.

example.ex: The defendant asked for 21 similar offences to be taken into account...
example.tran: 被告要求考虑到类似的21起违法行为的情况。

example.ex: Urban planners in practice have to take account of many interest groups in society.
example.tran: 城市规划人员在实际工作中必须把社会各利益集团都考虑在内。

entry.tran: （对所做的错事）被要求解释并遭斥责，被问责
entry.def: If someone is called, held, or brought to account for something they have done wrong, they are made to explain why they did it, and are often criticized or punished for it.

example.ex: Ministers should be called to account for their actions.
example.tran: 部长们应该对他们的行为作出解释。

means.word_mean: 1. a formal contractual relationship established to provide for regular banking or brokerage or business services;

sentences.sentence: "he asked to see the executive who handled his account"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of informing by verbal report;

sentences.sentence: "he heard reports that they were causing trouble"
"by all accounts they were a happy couple"

means.word_mean: 3. a record or narrative description of past events;

sentences.sentence: "a history of France"
"he gave an inaccurate account of the plot to kill the president"
"the story of exposure to lead"

means.word_mean: 4. a short account of the news;

sentences.sentence: "the report of his speech"
"the story was on the 11 o'clock news"
"the account of his speech that was given on the evening news made the governor furious"

means.word_mean: 5. a statement of recent transactions and the resulting balance;

sentences.sentence: "they send me an accounting every month"

means.word_mean: 6. a statement that makes something comprehensible by describing the relevant structure or operation or circumstances etc.;

sentences.sentence: "the explanation was very simple"
"I expected a brief account"

means.word_mean: 7. an itemized statement of money owed for goods shipped or services rendered;

sentences.sentence: "he paid his bill and left"
"send me an account of what I owe"

means.word_mean: 8. grounds;

sentences.sentence: "don't do it on my account"
"the paper was rejected on account of its length"
"he tried to blame the victim but his success on that score was doubtful"

means.word_mean: 9. importance or value;

sentences.sentence: "a person of considerable account"
"he predicted that although it is of small account now it will rapidly increase in importance"

means.word_mean: 10. the quality of taking advantage;

sentences.sentence: "she turned her writing skills to good account"

means.word_mean: 1. be the sole or primary factor in the existence, acquisition, supply, or disposal of something;

sentences.sentence: "Passing grades account for half of the grades given in this exam"

means.word_mean: 2. keep an account of
3. to give an account or representation of in words;

sentences.sentence: "Discreet Italian police described it in a manner typically continental"

means.word_mean: 4. furnish a justifying analysis or explanation;

sentences.sentence: "I can't account for the missing money"

auth_sentence.content: You'd be much better than any parody account.
auth_sentence.res_content: You'd be much better than any parody account.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You'd be much better than any parody account.

auth_sentence.content: We need clinical trials that take this into account.
auth_sentence.res_content: We need clinical trials that take this into account.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We need clinical trials that take this into account.

auth_sentence.content: Why am I being asked to upgrade my account?
auth_sentence.res_content: Why am I being asked to upgrade my account?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Why am I being asked to upgrade my account?

Sentence.sentence: E-books now account for 14 percent of all book sales in the country and are increasing far faster than overall book sales.
At the age of six she started reading the daily financial newspapers and opened her own bank account.
What could have accounted for Al Herpin's sleeplessness?
What we have to do is make sure we know what these are and take into account all the possible variables
And cross-cultural comparisons can t account for difference of opinion
The production and application of fertilisers and pesticides account for the largest part of energy use in the modern industrialised agricultural process.

means.word_mean: 账, 账户

sentences.en: The sum of money has been transferred into my account.

means.word_mean: (关于特定事务或事件的口头或笔头的)描述，描写；叙述，记述；报道；记事；故事

sentences.en: The two accounts of the accident do not agree.
sentences.cn: 有关这次事件两则报道不一致。

means.word_mean: 说明原因(或理由)，提出理由；是…的原因；做出说明(或解释)，解释(for)

sentences.en: His illness accounts for his absence.
sentences.cn: 他因为生病, 所以才缺席。

sentences.en: He has to account to the chairman for how he spends the company's money.
sentences.cn: 他一定要向主席说明他是如何花公司的钱的。

means.word_mean: 为…负责；导致，引起(与for连用)

sentences.en: His reckless driving accounted for the accident.
sentences.cn: 他开车鲁莽，引起了这场事故。

means.word_mean: (在数量、比例方面)占；共计达

sentences.en: It accounts for 25 per cent of all traffic accidents.

means.word_mean: 以为，认为，把…看做，把…视作

sentences.en: We all account him a qualified teacher.
sentences.cn: 我们都认为他是一名合格的教师。

sentences.en: He accounted it fun to go to sea.

means.word_mean: 钻研；分析；探究；考虑

sentences.en: This report will be accounted by the committee.
sentences.cn: 委员会将研究这份报告。

means.word_mean: [罕用语]把…归因于，把…归咎于(to)；把…转嫁于(to)

sentences.en: She has many virtues accounted to her.

jushi.english: Please don't cook on my account—I'm perfectly happy with a sandwich.
jushi.chinese: 请不要为我做饭——我吃三明治很好。

jushi.english: I have $150 in my bank account.
jushi.chinese: 我的银行户头上有150美元。

jushi.english: Several eyewitnesses' accounts differed considerably from the official version of events .
jushi.chinese: 几位目击者的叙述与官方报道相差相当大。
